meta.notes: High level amateur right-handed golfer with right eye dominance and good athletic build, swinging a mid-iron.

summary.headline: Solid fundamentally sound mid-iron swing with slight room for refinement in transition and low point control.
bullets: Strong and stable setup posture supporting a powerful coil.
Good wrist hinge creating width and leverage through the backswing.
Consistent clubface control leading to accurate shot dispersion.
Minor weight shift timing issues affecting low point consistency.
Swing path generally on plane but can improve shallow entry angle.

strengths: Athletic and balanced setup promoting an efficient coil.
Strong connection to the lower body during backswing.
Effective use of wrist hinge for width and power.
Good control of clubface orientation through impact.
Consistent takeaway path aligned with target line.

priorityFixes.title: Improve weight shift timing
priorityFixes.detail: Work on syncing lower body movement into downswing earlier to promote better low point control and more consistent ball striking.

priorityFixes.title: Shallow the club path at transition
priorityFixes.detail: Focus on slightly flattening the club's descent angle to reduce steepness and enhance strike quality.

priorityFixes.title: Maintain centered pivot through impact
priorityFixes.detail: Avoid over-rotating hips away from the ball at impact to keep consistent low point and improve contact quality.

powerLeaks: Late lower body initiation leading to deceleration through impact.
Slight casting of the hands on transition reducing clubhead speed.
Early extension causing some loss of coil and power.
Minor steepness on down path limiting compressive force.

checkpoints.label: Setup
checkpoints.note: Balanced athletic posture with proper spine tilt and ball position.
errors: Too upright posture reducing coil potential.
Ball position too far forward or back causing inconsistent contact.
drills: Mirror check posture and ball position before each swing.
Wall drill to ensure address spine angle remains fixed.

checkpoints.label: Takeaway
checkpoints.note: Smooth one-piece takeaway keeping clubhead low and on target line.
errors: Excessive hand movement causing early clubface rotation.
Too steep or too flat path off the tee.
drills: Slow-motion takeaway focusing on low and slow movement.
Use alignment rods to maintain path during takeaway.

checkpoints.label: Top of backswing
checkpoints.note: Full rotation with strong weight transfer and wide arc.
errors: Limited shoulder turn leading to restricted power.
Over-bent leading wrist causing inconsistent release.
drills: Seated rotation drills to increase shoulder turn.
Swing with towel under armpits to maintain connection.

checkpoints.label: Transition
checkpoints.note: Slight delay in lower body initiation affecting rhythm and low point.
errors: Upper body starting downswing before hips.
Casting hands early clearing potential power.
drills: Step drill focusing on hip lead through impact.
Pause-and-go drill to sync lower and upper body timing.

checkpoints.label: Downswing
checkpoints.note: Good lag creation but sometimes steep club path reducing strike quality.
errors: Too vertical shaft plane causing heavy turf interactions.
Early sliding of hips losing connection to swing plane.
drills: Swing with impact bag emphasizing shallow entry.
Feet-together swings to promote rotation over lateral movement.

checkpoints.label: Impact
checkpoints.note: Consistent square clubface with solid compression and divot control.
errors: Occasional heel or toe strikes from minor low point inconsistencies.
drills: Impact tape to monitor strike pattern.
Divot control drills focusing on ball-first contact.

checkpoints.label: Release
checkpoints.note: Smooth release with hands ahead of the clubhead at impact.

checkpoints.label: Finish
checkpoints.note: Balanced full finish facing the target with good extension.
errors: Incomplete rotation leaving tension in the body.
drills: Hold finish position for counts of 3-5 seconds.

checkpoints.label: Setup to start line control
checkpoints.note: Excellent alignment and path control leading to consistent ball flight.
errors: Path mismatch causing push or pull shots.
drills: Alignment rod routine before every shot.
Swinging along target line drills using visual aids.

practicePlan.overview: Focus the next 14 days on improving transition timing and downswing path, while reinforcing your already strong fundamentals. This balanced approach will refine power delivery and consistency.

days.label: DAYS 1–2: Transition Timing
days.focus: Synchronizing lower body and upper body start
days.detail: Practice drills emphasizing starting downswing with hips before arms, such as step drills and pause-and-go swings to build muscle memory and improve rhythm.

days.label: DAYS 3–5: Downswing Plane
days.focus: Shallowing the club path for better strike
days.detail: Use impact bag and feet-together drills to encourage a shallower, more inside club approach, reducing steepness and improving turf interaction.

days.label: DAYS 6–7: Weight Shift and Low Point
days.focus: Promoting early and balanced weight transfer
days.detail: Work on drills that encourage weight move onto front foot at transition to enable consistent low point control and pure ball striking.

days.label: DAYS 8–10: Reinforce Setup and Impact
days.detail: Mirror checks and alignment rod usage before every swing, combined with impact tape or divot control drills to track impact quality.

days.label: DAYS 11–14: Full Swing Integration
days.detail: Integrate timing and path improvements into full swings, gradually increasing speed to build confidence and consistency under more realistic conditions.
